div.p: We performed XRS measurements on novel material compositions with cubic perovskite structure to be potentially used as cathodes in Protonic Ceramic Fuel Cell (PCFC). These contain barium in the A-site and iron, zirconium and yttrium in the B-site. The amount of yttrium is fixed instead the one of zirconium and iron is variable. We measured BaZr0.88-xY0.12FexO3-d samples with Fe content of x = 0.03, 0.06, 0.1, 0.3, 0.7 (with iron in Fe 3+ oxidation state) and x = 0.06, 0.3, 0.7 (with iron in Fe 4+ oxidation state). These data will be complemented with the EXAFS experiment to be performed at the beginning of next year (MA 4582). XRS already prooved to be a useful tool to directly probe the electronic states involving the oxygen and the transition metal [1] allowing an understanding of the TM-O bond covalence in similar materials. This quantity is important for the propensity of proton incorporation. The data are collected at the O K-edge (530-565 eV) with an incident energy at 9.7 KeV. Relevant spectra for the O K-edge are reported in Figure 1.

Figure 1 demonstrates how the amount and the formal oxidation state of iron influence the oxygen electronic states. In particular, the pre peak at ≈527 eV (hybridization of oxygen 2p and iron 3d orbitals) is:
Absent for reduced samples independent of the quantity of iron. (ii)
Increasing its magnitude with increasing quantity of iron for oxidized samples.

div.p: We plan to perform simulation for these data using the FDMNES package and more details will be provided in the future.
